title: Vietnam: The Television War
description: Learn Vietnam: The Television War in one minute.

hook.text: For the first time, Americans watched a war on TV during dinner. Public opinion shifted dramatically.

buildup.text: Vietnam was the first war covered extensively by television â€” uncensored footage aired nightly.

discovery.text: Images of napalm strikes, wounded Marines, and burning villages contradicted official optimism.

twist.text: Walter Cronkite declared the war unwinnable on air. Lyndon Johnson said 'If I've lost Cronkite, I've lost America.'

climax.text: Vietnam proved that visual journalism could turn public opinion against a war â€” a lesson every government learned.

punchline.text: The camera became the most powerful antiwar weapon.

quiz.question: What effect did television coverage have on the Vietnam War?
options: It turned public opinion against the war
It increased support for the war
